title: Windows 10 AIO 30in1 Base v2 x32 x64 DaRT10 murphy78

murphy78 presents Windows 10 AIO 30in1 base v2 DualBoot en-US

No Windows 10 Settings were harmed in the making of this ISO.
No Programs are added to Windows.
No Unattended Settings were added to the installation.
No Registry Settings were modified.

Tools used:

oscdimg for ISO mastering
DiskPart script v1.2.8
Microsoft DaRT 10
Added Info folder to Setup dir to annoy credit thieves.

DISM /add-package and /resetbase (boot.wim and winre.wim):
KB3081448

DISM /add-package and /resetbase (Indexes only):
KB3074678, KB3074686, KB3081449, KB3087916

Features:
-DualBoot setup with UEFI/Fat32 support
-Upgrade files to upgrade from Win7/8
-Some useful scripts added to iso.
-DiskPart setup script v1.2.8 - Just boot to setup media
and press shift-f10 to bring up console and then type "Menu"

Instructions:
-Use a USB program such as RUFUS to put this on a 16GB+ USB
Flash drive for boot installs.
-For upgrade, you can simply mount the iso and run setup.exe
-For boot (clean install), change BIOS or UEFI settings
to point to boot device. For UEFI, makes sure the device
has "UEFI:" in the description.
-For Activation, if you didn't use the Upgrade option/offer
run Microsoft Toolkit (torrent magnet provided) and select
Windows button, Activation tab, and EZ-Activator option.*
*Keep MTK handy somewhere if you ever need to uninstall the
activator for some reason. Future MTK versions might not
be backward compatible for uninstall or settings changes.

Privacy Notes:
-Use the Customize option during OOBE account setup phase
-Uncheck the stuff that sends data to MS if you value privacy
-Run both telemetry scripts in the scripts folder
-Either disable Windows Defender completely or go into
settings->update->Defender and disable cloud and sample submit
-Running any Windows App (store type apps) will send data to ms
-There are some app uninstall tools, but I have not included
them as it's far wiser to simply install LTSB version if you
want to have a version that lacks apps.
-There are a few decent privacy apps out there, but they
are still very over-zealous.
-I have included a script to turn the search box into a
computer-only search (no internet search)
-Between telemetry scripts, defender options, and search box,
most or all of the spying stuff is blocked.
-I am unsure about the error reporting as I haven't seen it
actually send any data in my sniffing, but if you are paranoid
you can feel free to disable it in settings->Privacy

Exta Notes:
-This version does not have a cumulative update integrated.
-After setup, go into Settings->Update and let it download
the latest update and restart your system.
-Cumulative updates are being released very often, so this
is the best way to maintain a very large AIO while still
being able to upgrade and fit on a fat32 UFD.
-x64-only version has sxs folder removed so that it is
able to be burned onto a Single Layer DVDR
-SXS folder is where the offline netfx3 installer is stored
but the cumulative update will download a newer version.
-After setup, if you need to install netfx3, make sure to
download updates first, as it will simply install from
system files after you update.
-My Netfx3 script is not designed for dual-boot setup, but
it should do online or system file feature enable just fine.

Enjoy,
murphy78 :)
